meanings.definition: The act of inciting or stirring up
meanings.sent1: Her incitations led to a heated argument among the group.
meanings.sent2: The incitations of the speaker riled up the crowd.
meanings.sent3: The incitations of the mischievous squirrel caused chaos in the park.
meanings.sent4: His incitations were like adding fuel to the fire of the situation.
meanings.sent5: The incitations of the coach motivated the team to give their best performance.

meanings.sent1: The article was an incitations for further research on the topic.
meanings.sent2: His words were an incitations for change within the community.
meanings.sent3: The mysterious letter served as an unexpected incitations for adventure.
meanings.sent4: The painting was an incitations for deep contemplation.
meanings.sent5: The movie acted as an incitations for discussions among friends.

meanings.definition: To incite or provoke someone to action
meanings.sent1: The leader incitations the team to strive for excellence.
meanings.sent2: She incitations her students to think critically about the problem.
meanings.sent3: The comedian incitations laughter from the audience with his jokes.
meanings.sent4: His speech incitations a sense of unity among the diverse crowd.
meanings.sent5: The music incitations a feeling of nostalgia in the listeners.
